meeting_history.notes: Introductory call linking TME (Mongolian sponsor) with Guotai Haitong. GH expressed strong interest in participating as arranger for TME’s project bond, contingent on mandate execution. They have recent Mongolia issuance experience and a defined investor base. GH will run internal credit work (2–3 weeks) post-mandate and can introduce 2–3 investors per Hong Kong session. Appetite confirmed for unrated EM infra debt (energy/coal), provided standard listing, ISIN, and Euroclear are in place.
meeting_history.participants: Joss Fisher, CT, AB, NA, AS, TME

meeting_history.notes:
TME + Eightstone Introduction 

Eightstone signalled cautious interest: they’re broadly comfortable with the credit but want structural issues resolved and clearer investor protections (security, covenants, step-in) before committing. They indicated a **max ~USD 15m** ticket, prefer **club-style** participation, and could introduce larger institutions (~USD 100m each) if the structure stacks up. They asked for **Singapore meetings** despite the HK track, and a focused **Investor Q&A** once materials are tightened. Commercially, **payments are timely**, effectively **power-for-cash daily** via NDC. Legally, this will be **Reg S (not 144A)** with documents expected to take **~4 weeks**, **counsel TBD**, and **closing timing still uncertain** pending documentation and scheduling.
meeting_history.participants: AS, CT, NA, AB, TME Team

meeting_history.notes: The meeting focused on early structuring discussions for a coal-fired power plant project in Mongolia, involving the sponsor (TME), prospective anchor investor (GMO), and Meridian. GMO, represented by Mustafa Ulukan, positioned itself as a long-term holder and flagged the call feature as a critical issue, stating that a standard high-yield call structure is non-negotiable and that they would likely be the largest investor. TME’s Ganjoloo Ochirpurev provided initial project context, while Meridian committed to updating the financial model to reflect semi-annual Yield to Call scenarios from Year 2 onwards, with callable prices at 104% and 102% in Years 2 and 3 respectively. Aijan requested Kush to implement these changes post-call. The meeting confirmed alignment on long-term investor expectations and flagged the need for further sponsor-side detail.
meeting_history.participants: AS, CT, NA, MJ, Ganjoloo Ochirpurev (TME), Adamant
